question: All responsibilities regarding elections in India are entrusted to which of the following authorities?
explanation: The Chief Election Commissioner is responsible for the conduct of free and fair elections in India.Â  He heads the Election Commission of India. It is a body constitutionally empowered to conduct free and fair elections to the national and state legislatures and of President and Vice-President. This power of the Election Commission of India is derived from the Article 324 of the Constitution of India.
